basics.name: Kamal Kishor Sharma
basics.summary: With a bachelor's in Aerospace Engineering and a PhD in Applied Mathematics, I offer a unique blend of engineering pragmatism and mathematical rigour. I bring four years of experience solving complex engineering problems at the Indian Space Research Organisation, along with another four years conducting research in computational physics.

work.name: University of Hamburg
work.summary: Research in applied mathematics and computational physics.
highlights: Conducted the first numerical simulations of an idealized stochastic climate model
Developed numerical solvers using Python for various geophysical fluid dynamics (GFD) models
Performed tests to quantify uncertainty due to unresolved small-scale processes in GFD models
Developed algorithms for statistical analysis and time-series modeling of model outputs
Published research and presented at 5 international conferences

work.name: Department of Mathematics, University of Hamburg
work.summary: Taught and supervised Master's level courses and projects.
highlights: Taught a Master's level course on Mathematical Machine Learning
Supervised projects on Large Language Models (LLMs) and Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs)

work.name: Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO)
work.summary: Structural analysis and design for space systems.
highlights: Performed Finite Element Analysis (FEA) for key space systems
Thermo-structural analysis and testing of scramjet engine flow duct
Thermo-structural analysis of the wing of ISRO's first reusable launch vehicle
Payload adapter design for the Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle
Thermal screen development for the cryogenic stage of the GSLV
Conducted structural dynamics testing of satellites and sub-systems
Used ANSYS and Abaqus for design validation and risk assessment

education.thesis: Development of a structure-preserving idealized stochastic climate model
education.supervisor: Dr. Peter Korn (Max-Planck Institute for Meteorology, Germany)

education.institution: Indian Institute of Space Science and Technology (IIST)

awards.summary: Covering tuition and accommodation for Bachelor's studies
